page.title: 07NORTHERN COMPUTERS
page.content: The firm was founded 3\ years ago in a lounge in Warrington. Six months later they moved to Frodsham, recently opening two showrooms in Chester and Manchester. With a turnover of 3.5 million pounds they employ 45. Only 10% of their business is retail with 45% dealing with schools and 45% industry. They have sole rights to sell the new Amstrad CPC 664 to schools. They have a large service department, hoping to finish repairs in under 2 weeks, mobile engineers will visit firms to effect on the spot repairs. A design section develops new products, these being assembled in a part of the service department. Disc drives are also assembled here, the parts being manufactured elsewhere. The bulk of their business is mail order and Prestel has just been installed to improve efficiency.
